BotAliasStatus.description: The current status of the bot alias. When the status is Available the alias is ready for use with your bot.

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot alias.

BotAliasId.description: The unique identifier of the bot alias.

S3Bucket.description: The S3 bucket location where audio logs are stored.

AudioLogDestination.description: Specifies the S3 bucket location where audio logs are stored.

Destination.description: The location of audio log files collected when conversation logging is enabled for a bot.

Enabled.description: Determines whether audio logging in enabled for the bot.

AudioLogSetting.description: Settings for logging audio of conversations between Amazon Lex and a user. You specify whether to log audio and the Amazon S3 bucket where the audio file is stored.

CodeHookSpecification.description: Specifies the Lambda function that should be used in the locale.

Enabled.description: Determines whether the locale is enabled for the bot. If the value is `false` , the locale isn't available for use.

BotAliasLocaleSettings.description: Specifies settings that are unique to a locale. For example, you can use different Lambda function depending on the bot's locale.

BotAliasLocaleSetting.description: Specifies settings that are unique to a locale.

LocaleId.description: The unique identifier of the locale.

BotAliasLocaleSettingsItem.description: Specifies settings that are unique to a locale. For example, you can use different Lambda function depending on the bot's locale.

CloudWatchLogGroupArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the log group where text and metadata logs are delivered.

LogPrefix.description: The prefix of the log stream name within the log group that you specified

CloudWatchLogGroupLogDestination.description: The Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group where the text and metadata logs are delivered. The log group must exist before you enable logging.

LambdaCodeHook.description: Specifies a Lambda function that verifies requests to a bot or fulfills the user's request to a bot.

CodeHookSpecification.description: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

AudioLogSettings.description: The Amazon S3 settings for logging audio to an S3 bucket.

TextLogSettings.description: The Amazon CloudWatch Logs settings for logging text and metadata.

ConversationLogSettings.description: Configures conversation logging that saves audio, text, and metadata for the conversations with your users.

CodeHookInterfaceVersion.description: The version of the request-response that you want Amazon Lex to use to invoke your Lambda function.

LambdaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function.

LambdaCodeHook.description: Specifies a Lambda function that verifies requests to a bot or fulfills the user's request to a bot.

KmsKeyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key for encrypting audio log files stored in an Amazon S3 bucket.

LogPrefix.description: The S3 prefix to assign to audio log files.

S3BucketArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon S3 bucket where audio log files are stored.

S3BucketLogDestination.description: Specifies an Amazon S3 bucket for logging audio conversations

CloudWatch.description: Defines the Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group where text and metadata logs are delivered.

TextLogDestination.description: Defines the Amazon CloudWatch Logs destination log group for conversation text logs.

Destination.description: Defines the Amazon CloudWatch Logs destination log group for conversation text logs.

Enabled.description: Determines whether conversation logs should be stored for an alias.

TextLogSetting.description: Defines settings to enable text conversation logs.

description:
> Amazon Lex V2 is the only supported version in AWS CloudFormation . 

Specifies an alias for the specified version of a bot. Use an alias to enable you to change the version of a bot without updating applications that use the bot.

For example, you can specify an alias called "PROD" that your applications use to call the Amazon Lex bot.

BotAliasLocaleSettings.description: Specifies settings that are unique to a locale. For example, you can use different Lambda function depending on the bot's locale.

BotAliasName.description: The name of the bot alias.

BotAliasTags.description:
An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

You can only add tags when you specify an alias.

For more information, see [Tag](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-resource-tags.html) .

BotId.description: The unique identifier of the bot.

BotVersion.description: The version of the bot that the bot alias references.

ConversationLogSettings.description: Specifies whether Amazon Lex logs text and audio for conversations with the bot. When you enable conversation logs, text logs store text input, transcripts of audio input, and associated metadata in Amazon CloudWatch logs. Audio logs store input in Amazon S3 .

Description.description: The description of the bot alias.

SentimentAnalysisSettings.description: Determines whether Amazon Lex will use Amazon Comprehend to detect the sentiment of user utterances.
